text: Clare McCann is an Australian actress, writer, director, singer, dancer and costume designer. ==Career== She rose to national fame in 2007 on Foxtel's Channel V as Cherry for the TV series Blog Party and was a dancer and member of the Parramatta Eels cheer squad."New Break for Young Star". Blacktown Advocate. 15 July 2009.Tennant, Erin. "Girls leap into squad". Blacktown Advocate, 9 May 2007, p. 12Tennant, Erin. "Add a good voice". Blacktown Advocate, 7 February 2007, p. 27Jarvis, Nick. "Fancy a trance dancer?". 3dworld, 24 March 2008. Clare is also known for leading the Save The Roxy Theatre campaign which led to a promise of protection for the theatre at the famous Roxy Theatre in Parramatta. Clare McCann was given a scholarship to train at the prestigious ATYP and began performing in local community theatre productions.Tennant, Erin. "Flashdancer win". Blacktown Advocate, 9 August 2006, p. 11 McCann then began writing and directing plays for her local theatre company. Her first play, Superheroes R Us was labeled by the local press as being so popular that it had standing room only. The following year McCann wrote and directed another popular play Fairyland."Short cut to fame". Blacktown Advocate. 24 March 2004, p.19. McCann then left Channel V and the cheersquad and landed the role of Mimi in the musical RENT In 2012 McCann became the Creative Director for Marquee at the Star Casino. There she managed dance shows working with artists like Paris Hilton, Will.i.am of Black Eyed Peas and LMFAO Redfoo.Nauman, Zoe. "Dom Perignon Masquerade Party". Daily Telegraph. 2013. In 2015 Clare was voted by Star Central Magazine as the Most Promising Actress for her upcoming leading roles as Jane in Anthony Brown's production of Jane Eyre and as Janet Weiss in Craig Henry's 40th Anniversary Rocky Horror Show Australian tour. In 2016 Clare won an international screenplay writers award for Benefited, her directorial debut feature film which brings awareness to domestic violence and the lack of housing support available for women and children escaping these situations. Benefited is set for release in 2020. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:21st- century Australian actresses Category:Australian women writers Category:Australian film directors Category:Australian women film directors Category:Living people Category:1980s births
